text: Hi guys! Today I'm going to make one of our family favourites which is a fish pie. They do actually

I've already peeled and chopped into like two centimetre chunks.
They've boiled for about 15 minutes so about eight minutes before they're finished add your eggs.
minutes before they're finished add your eggs because that saves on using another saucepan and wasting time
and they can just share the potato water.
So now I'm gonna make the really delicious creamy sauce which is kind of like the base of the dish.
50 grams of butter. Start on a medium heat first of all and then 50 grams of flour which is gonna
make the, posh name 'the roux'. I've actually got

so it gets the most flavour out them.
So make sure that you get all your lumps out. I've got 350 mils of milk and slowly stir in.

Whisking now. I'm gonna bring up to boil and that's so you know, that'll trigger the flour and that'll sort of

Takes about ten minutes. Keep stirring this a bit
